website_summaries.verdict: An energy-saving smart power strip that lowers your operating costs by reducing standby power waste.
pros: Allows you to control supplied power to electronics in your entertainment system
Offers superb power management for home office and commercial workspace applications
Includes advanced surge protection technology with ceramic-encased metal oxide varistors that suppress more energy and dissipate heat faster than traditional surge protectors
cons: Outlets are very close to one another
Instructions may be tough to follow

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised. The three-position sensitivity switch operation is clearly explained in the instructions. I use my TV as the control, with my amp, blu ray player, and subwoofer plugged into the switched outlets. There is a bit of a delay when I turn the TV on (maybe 5 seconds), and when it turns on the other components fire right up. I like it!
customer_reviews.author: BowWow

customer_reviews.title: Do not waste you money
customer_reviews.text: Two of these failed in 7 months period, i filed warranty form and made calls to the company but i got no answer. Do not waste you money , look somewhere else.
customer_reviews.author: abdelhamid alkoum

customer_reviews.title: Read this if you have a smart TV
customer_reviews.text: If you have a smart tv do not buy. I had my smart tv placed in the control outlet and everytime my tv screen would go dark, in between commercials or whatever, it would turn everything off. I then moved my tv to the always on outlet and plugged my surround sound into the control outlet, and it didn’t have enough power to turn the rest of my things on. I wish I would not have wasted my money on this.
customer_reviews.author: javard

customer_reviews.title: Loud clicking noise every 30 seconds when not in use!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awful! My previous smart strip went out and I got this as a replacement. It’s horrible! It constantly clicks on and off (cycles the power) when I’m not using the control device...like every 30 seconds. It’s loud and super annoying. I can’t imagine it’s saving any energy by cycling the power constantly. I end up having to unplug everything. I’ve tried all 3 threshold settings and nothing changes. Unfortunately I missed the return window. I’ll be replacing it with a different brand though.
customer_reviews.author: m.f.

customer_reviews.title: Easy way to save some $$$ on your electric bill
customer_reviews.text: Excellent for saving vampire loads from game systems, DVD players, sound bars, etc. Turns power to accesories off with TV power off. Has always on outlet for your cable box if you have a DVR or anything else that needs constant power. Good fast seller
customer_reviews.author: mp

customer_reviews.title: Do you really need this?
customer_reviews.text: I should have read the directions online more carefully. It works for TV OR computer. If all you have is a modem/computer/printer, or a TV/cable box, you might not need this. The sockets are "always on" for modem/cable box and "control" for computer/TV. So the only thing I am saving with this powerstrip is the energy for the printer. It's a very nice powerstrip, and probably great for people who have large systems with lots of devices.
customer_reviews.author: R. Turner

customer_reviews.title: Fails every few days
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't matter how my TV and accessories are plugged in, every 2-3 days everything loses power and I have to reset my xfinity box and speakers. Worked for about 6 months before the failures started. Don't be sucked in by the advanced features: green outlets and words like "control" and "always on". I just replaced this junk with a Belkin.
customer_reviews.author: daors64

customer_reviews.title: Only works with one IR remote controlled system in the room and motion is always detected
customer_reviews.text: If you have two separate systems, such as audio and tv or 2 tvs in the same room, it will turn on whenever any IR remote button is pushed. If your main device does not have an IR remote, it will not work. Switching on the system manually does not switch on the other sockets. IF you wan to run a device in an unoccupied room, such as a music system, it will not work because it shuts off if no motion is detected.
customer_reviews.author: C. Grant

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: like other reviews...worked for about 2 months and then quit.....don't buy it
customer_reviews.author: travelwise

customer_reviews.title: Fixed my Roku HDCP problem
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to power on and off my new Roku Ultra with my TV. The new Roku has a HDCP flaw that requires it to be rebooted every 2 - 3 days, so this solves the problem by turning it on / off with the TV. Power strip seems to be a high quality item and has a nice space saving angled wall plug. I was originally looking for a power strip with a 12v 3.5mm power trigger that I could use with my receiver but couldn’t find one anywhere, this would be a good feature to add.
customer_reviews.author: Jason F.

customer_reviews.title: Smart surge protector
customer_reviews.text: Perfect solution for my Bluetooth receiver. I purchased a used Yamaha surround sound receiver and wanted to turn it into a Bluetooth receiver. To prevent burning up/wearing out the Bluetooth device it was recommended to get an advanced surge protector that powers on and off when the receiver turns on and off. Works as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Specializedchuck

customer_reviews.title: Using monitor as control to shut off everything when iMac goes to sleep
customer_reviews.text: Just what I needed! I was disappointed when I found using the iMac as control would not switch off my 2 speakers and 2 monitors. I decided to use a monitor as the control and I would just switch everything on and off by powering off the control monitor. To my surprise, when the monitor goes to sleep, it powers off the switched outlets, which is exactly what I wanted the power stirip to do! So, if you have things you want to switch off when your computer goes to sleep, use one of your monitors as control.
customer_reviews.author: Michael K

customer_reviews.title: Simple way to reduce your electric bill. I have ...
customer_reviews.text: Simple way to reduce your electric bill. I have one in my living room so when the audio receiver turns off, TV, ps4, speakers, record player all lose power. One in my office so when the computer is off, it cuts power to monitors and other things. It's reduced my electric bill noticeably and is simple to set up. There is a small delay between when you turn on the control device and when power comes back on to the other devices, but it's not enough of a delay to bother me at all.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly, turns off all my stuff as one
customer_reviews.text: I use this with my home theater to turn on my fans and zone 2 amplifier. Nicer amps use a 12v trigger but mine didn't have it and i am very happy i found this solution. My receiver is plugged into the trigger outlet of this strip and when i turn on my receiver it powers on the fans, my amp, and my TV. My amp was very poorly rated for its standby power, and now i can leave it to "stay on" and it gets disconnected when i turn off my system. Brilliant work. Triggers almost instantly when i turn on my receiver, and turns off within a second of turning it off.
customer_reviews.author: Dancinpete

customer_reviews.title: love that I can power everything of by just turning ...
customer_reviews.text: I need a few more, thinking about one in every room that has a tv and other equipment. Currently have my pc, 3 monitors, and speakers connected, love that I can power everything of by just turning off pc. This is awesome because I can save energy since I go days without using the pc, always on my tablet or phone. I've had strip for about a year now, no issues, will definitely buy again. Last thing, I was able to mount under desk, perfect for cable management which I'm really picky about.
customer_reviews.author: Eric C

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable switching
customer_reviews.text: I can't rely on this power strip to switch on/off as advertised, even after trying all threshold settings. Depending on the devices and threshold settings, they either won't trigger the power on or won't trigger the power off.
customer_reviews.author: crs.one

customer_reviews.title: Works great. However
customer_reviews.text: Works great. However, if you are planning to use with a computer be aware putting the computer to sleep or hibernate won't shut off any other devices connected to it. Only work if you shut it down the PC completely. I tried to use it LED light strips. Have light strip shut down whenever the computer is off. Did not work.
customer_reviews.author: iamkawsar

customer_reviews.title: Great deal for the price every little bit of savings ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased 2 of these hoping it would help lower my electric bill . It did just that ! I was able to drop my electric bill almost $100.00. Keep in mind I also changed my light bulbs and cut back slightly on my air condition but it's clear these energy efficient strips were a factor in my savings. It helps turn everything off instead of leaving Xbox or PlayStation and tvs and sound systems on because you fell asleep. Save your money ! Great deal for the price every little bit of savings helps .
customer_reviews.author: Renee

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased two of these. One for my living room; Router = Always On, TV = Control, XBOX ONE/Roku/Speakers/etc = Switch. One for my office room; Computer Tower = Control, Monitor/Speakers/Printer/etc = Switch. They work just as intended. Shipped quickly and nicely packaged. They're heavy duty and bigger in person. I thought they were made backwards, but they positioned the wording on that side so you can always see them if that makes sense. I'm yet to see my electric bill, but I did not have to fiddle with the power amount.
customer_reviews.author: ICH8RS

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: I am using this for an arcade cabinet that is run by a desktop PC. The PC is plugged into the control outlet, and I have an LED light strip, audio amplifier, monitor, and Logitech G27 steering wheel plugged into the switched outlets. I haven't had this very long, so I can't comment on its longevity, but it is working great. I was really pleased to find that if I set the sensitivity to the medium setting, the switching works when the PC is put to sleep. Great product at a great price!
customer_reviews.author: Xylem

customer_reviews.title: works great with my TV
customer_reviews.text: Works great, plugged in my LED TV to the Control outlet and my amplifier and subwoofer into two of the power saver outlets... now my stereo only comes on when the TV is on ... (not sure how much power I'm saving; but it feels good). The sensitivity switch is important to set properly; i set mine to high (40W) and had zero problems. I like that it's very simple and I don't have to think about it. Because the amplifier is only for watching TV/movies, there's never a situation where we need it on without the TV on, so it makes sense to use this kind of outlet where the TV is the control for my amplifier and subwoofer.
customer_reviews.author: princess posse

customer_reviews.title: It does what it says it will do.
customer_reviews.text: It works great for what I needed. I am using it to turn on a subwoofer when I turn on my receiver. I have an older subwoofer set up that does not have the circuitry to turn it on automatically. I plugged the receiver into the control socket and the subwoofer amp into one of the switched sockets. When I turn on the receiver, the sub powers up and I don't have to get up and go plug it in. I just got it today, so I can't judge how long it will work, but right now it's working perfectly. I'll update this review if it stops working.
customer_reviews.author: David and Sharon

customer_reviews.title: Very easy
customer_reviews.text: Very easy and straightforward. It doesn't take much instruction, but the ones that it does have are very clear. Indicator lights cover anything you might need to know. Some people here are saying the thing is complicated and hard to use, and I feel like they're not even talking about the same product because that is nonsense. I cannot confirm if it helps with vampire power yet, I haven't had it long enough to know.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle C

customer_reviews.title: Plugs are way too close together
customer_reviews.text: This works for us, but only because I only had 2 other things plugged in besides my TV Forget it if you have more, you won't actually be able to use all the plugs unless you have very slim plugs. They are so close together that anything plugged in will overlap and make it so you can't plug anything into the ones next to it.
customer_reviews.author: Whisper

customer_reviews.title: Okay with some issues.
customer_reviews.text: I FINALLY put this together on my TV, DVD, Audio and Fire TV system - - the icons are great on the Strip itself. The only issue I've had is that it shuts off the whole system after watching TV for 2 hours. I can't figure out how to stop that... so.. I just stop watching after 2 hours now. Frustrating. OH, I also don't like the VERY bright green light it emits when the system is turned off. Because it is so bright - I've started just unplugging it when not in use.
customer_reviews.author: Christy Adair

customer_reviews.title: So Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: This unit worked great for about a week. I have my computer as the Control Device and my monitor and speaker as the switched devices. It worked wonderfully for a short time...then not so much. After a week the unit would shut my monitor and speaker off despite them being in current use. Yes, while I was actually using the computer. The computer would not shut down but the monitor would. Sadly, it is outside the return period so now I am stuck with a useless PowerStrip.
customer_reviews.author: Mena

customer_reviews.title: This power strip does exactly what it is supposed to ...
customer_reviews.text: This power strip does exactly what it is supposed to. I thought four controlled outlets seems too much at first. I have a PC with an external water circulator that I want to power on when the PC turns on. Once I added the monitor and an external optical drive, there was just one controlled outlet left. When set to medium sensitivity the power strip detects when the PC goes to sleep.
customer_reviews.author: Brchan

customer_reviews.title: Great idea, but doesn't work in real life conditions
customer_reviews.text: I love the concept. Wish it worked. Kept turning off and on my receiver, when tv screen would go black for just one second when loading nexflix or even while watching a show and fade to black transition was used by editor. Tried using all the different settings and still would occur. Not got for electronics to shut down and on over and over. Uses a lot more power that way too.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory W. Payne

customer_reviews.title: Works great to save you electricity.
customer_reviews.text: I use these in all the kids rooms so that when the TV is off the Video games aren't sucking volts away while no one is home and playing them. I have no problems with the strips sensing the TV's change and turning on or off the rest of the devices. There is a sensitivity switch on the side but I didn't need to even touch it because it just worked out of the box on the default setting.
customer_reviews.author: M - Poster

customer_reviews.title: Value for Money
customer_reviews.text: Use: Bedroom Master Outlet Pros: Works Well, Sturdy, Color Coding Helpful Cons: Bright Lights, A Bit Difficult to Use I have had this power strip for years and it has worked well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not for home theater switching
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this so that it could sense when I turned on my receiver and then for it to power up my power amps. But even in the off/standby mode, apparently my receiver draws too much power for this unit to turn off its switched outlets. The high setting doesn’t go high enough I assume. So the unit is worthless for my application.
customer_reviews.author: DVDmike

customer_reviews.title: Worked beautifully for about four months
customer_reviews.text: Worked beautifully for about four months! Then no longer powered the entire strip. Back to the old school surge protector and manually flipping it when not using the TV... smh
customer_reviews.author: A. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Great device for the price
customer_reviews.text: This multi outlet works great for anyone needing to address any a vampire devices in their entertainment system. The motion sensor does a great job of turning the system off when no one is in the room.
customer_reviews.author: A.J.

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: I have only had this for a few days. I have a cassette deck that when turned on, turns on my monitors, its really slick. I had to set the sensitivity to the lowest setting, so if it doesn't work at first, try playing with the sensitivity. I promise to update the review in a couple of months and let you all know about it's durability! So far I love it, its worth the price!
customer_reviews.author: chuckwolfe1978

customer_reviews.title: Does not work with modern, low power TV's
customer_reviews.text: I tried to use this on a TCL 65" Television and it did not work. The power strip would turn off the controlled outlets every time the screen went dark when selecting apps on the tv. I tried all of the sensitivity settings and it still did not work.
customer_reviews.author: HowieO

customer_reviews.title: but also a great deal more
customer_reviews.text: I was a little doubtful about this as it seemed to be able to do all that the much more expensive tool-triggered vacuum switches do, but also a great deal more. So far it has worked perfectly as long as the sensitivity is set to the lowest level. It would have to be more sensitive to be triggered by an audio system or TV but I have not tried it in that capacity. I have however used it with very large power tools, switching on a very powerful vacuum and it has given me no trouble whatsoever.
customer_reviews.author: Dave Carmichael

customer_reviews.title: A must if you want to save on your electric bill
customer_reviews.text: We Love this PowerStrip. For someone who cares about how much electricity is being used in the house, this is a must. It is very simple and easily labeled on the package to what electronics go where. I would recommend for someone who wants to decrease their power bill. Leaving your TV and cable box on all the time can pull power even when they are off. This will help eliminate some of that. If you need to leave something connected all the time for instance your router you can plug it in that outlet that doesn't shut off.
customer_reviews.author: Amber

customer_reviews.title: Good Product
customer_reviews.text: A little confusing at first. But now that I have the sensor setup with the longest timer, it doesn't shut off unexpectedly anymore. I mainly wanted my powered speakers to shut off along with the tv. Its nice that when I tell Alexa (via IR blaster) to turn off the tv, it shuts down everything. I have honestly noticed about a 30% reduction in my monthly energy consumption.
customer_reviews.author: Randy Wall

customer_reviews.title: Black model works differently from white model - still good energy savings
customer_reviews.text: I did not realize that the black version of this power strip was meant solely for televisions, but I can say that I use the white model for my computer and it saves me almost $100 annually. If you're on the fence about this power strip, it'll easily pay for itself in just a couple months!
customer_reviews.author: Dallas

customer_reviews.title: Does not work with iMac sleep mode; must completely shut down your PC
customer_reviews.text: It does work as advertised and the price is great, but it would be 100x better if the adjustable threshold applied to both turning on AND off. For example, on the medium 22W setting, the switched devices turn on when the control device consumption exceeds 22W, but it doesn't turn off the switched devices if the control device consumption falls below 22W - it only works when the control device is completely turned off.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph

customer_reviews.title: Love the Master outlets
customer_reviews.text: I have one of these for my upstairs computer. Needed one for gaming computer, but the store got first one at didn't carry them anymore. Amazon to the rescue. The Master outlet connected to the computer turns off the other equipment so I don't have to do it everytime.
customer_reviews.author: D. Babcock

customer_reviews.title: Awesome power saver
customer_reviews.text: Got this for the entertainment center. Plugged the TV into the switch outlet. A computer and a couple of boxes into the switched outlets. The only annoyance is the cable box having to reboot each time but the money it will save in the long run I think is worth it.
customer_reviews.author: JeremyTN

customer_reviews.title: This Is My Third One - I love Them
customer_reviews.text: This is my third Tricklestar surge strip, and I love them. I bought the first two through a program from my power company. Now, I am putting them just about everywhere. It's easy to set them up, and mine have worked true to the power level triggers. They are on all three TVs/peripherals in my house. The other two I bought are a little fancier (one has motion detection!), but this does the job.
customer_reviews.author: A

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic! Works great!. I've tried a dozen or more products like it and none were ever sensitive enough to be triggered by the very low current device I needed to use as the trigger. This unit (with an adjustable sensitivity switch) turned out to be just the ticket and the sensitivity could have been taken up even a step further if it had been needed.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Schaffer

customer_reviews.title: Worked for turning on Sony receiver with Sony XBR-75X850D
customer_reviews.text: These really simplified my home theater install - don't even need my Harmony remote anymore... I had to switch to the "high" power sense setting, but after that it consistently powers on my receiver after I turn on XBR-75X850D. There is a delay of about 1 second for the receiver turning on, and again 1 second after the tv is powered off for it to be turned off. So far I've had no issues with it powering off inadvertently during dark scenes, or during switching of inputs, when the tv is consuming less power. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: DigitalZen

customer_reviews.title: Save your money
customer_reviews.text: This powerstrip does NOT do what it said to do. I've done everything known to man to get this to work correctly and with the TV plugged into the TV outlet, I turn it on, everything else turns on viola' right. NOT, after everything turns on, then the tv turns off. Can't get anyone in customer support that can answer any questions. Not worth the effort. Save the money and turn things on and off with their own remotes.
customer_reviews.author: Mike H.

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm for MAME cabinet.
customer_reviews.text: Works great in a MAME cabinet. I have the sensor on a PC, and several things like a tv, light, and speakers on the others. Everything is off and on with one button in about 3 seconds. Great product in wish I had known about earlier.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Airaudi

customer_reviews.title: Saave money with TricleStar
customer_reviews.text: Very nice and works towards eliminating Vampie voltage. I received my first strip after participation in my local utility energy audit. The energy audit tech said it would help keep our electric usage low and save us money. I only wish it had USB outlets for charging. I Highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Vincent H

customer_reviews.title: They really work!
customer_reviews.text: Definitely seen a difference after I've started using them. Lower electrical bill. Can be a bit confusing during setup but it's doable.
customer_reviews.author: Zule World's

customer_reviews.title: This strip turns my amplifier on and off with my computer
customer_reviews.text: It works flawlessly turning off the amplifier that burns 70 watts. It will pay for itself in 3 months in electricity saved. I assume that people who had them fail were running higher loads through them. If it burns out, I will come back and edit this post.
customer_reviews.author: A. Edwards

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work with Samsung One Connect box
customer_reviews.text: I have a Samsung Q90 with the One connect box. Threshold settings made no difference when using the One Connect as the control. Switched my AV receiver to the control and works fine. Would I recommend this for a smart TV setup to control equipment? No. But for my application, controlling the media lighting when the TV is on, worked perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Tish

customer_reviews.title: Smart receptacle is a very useful feature.
customer_reviews.text: Smart receptacle is a very useful feature. I use it to turn off my monitors & all other unneeded periphals (except my laser printer) when my computer is off. Obviously saves energy but also turns off annoying standby lights. Although the status lights on the TrickleStar itself are way to bright!
customer_reviews.author: L Hess

customer_reviews.title: Nope
customer_reviews.text: Idk what’s wrong with it but it’s getting very finicky about when it wants to turn on the switched outlets. I’ve tried to changing the threshold levels and also unplugging/ plugging back in. Forget it.
customer_reviews.author: Raven

customer_reviews.title: Great addition to the
customer_reviews.text: This was a great addition to my home theater setup. My powered subwoofers' power switches are in awkward locations so using this powerstrip to automatically turn them on when the receiver is on very convenient. The powerstrip has 3 wattage choices to use for the on/off threshold which is quite handy. After I few minutes of trial and error, I found my receiver required using the middle setting to reliably turn the other devices on and off.
customer_reviews.author: DB

customer_reviews.title: I have another one like it that works fine
customer_reviews.text: I wanted this for the TV set up, but I wanted the control to be the Bose sound bar. That didn't work. It only worked if it was the TV. Actually, even then the peripherals didn't work through this. I have another one like it that works fine, but not this one.
customer_reviews.author: Dawn O then A

customer_reviews.title: Disapointed
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this in preparation for a home office and now that I have my equipment home I find out that this is completely dead it does not work it does not power anything
customer_reviews.author: Donna Earley

customer_reviews.title: Shuts off accessory equipment when my receiver goes off
customer_reviews.text: Works fine - when I turn the receiver off, anything plugged into the switched outlets of the powerstrip goes off, while anything plugged into the unswitched outlets stays on.
customer_reviews.author: R. W. Hoch

customer_reviews.title: Smaller electronics may not draw enough current to activate the control outlet
customer_reviews.text: Take note that many smaller electronics that use typical 12v or 24v wall wart adapters (turntables, smaller speakers, routers) will likely not draw enough power to activate the 'control' outlet. TVs, computers, etc. should be just fine. The wattage thresholds listed here may also be inaccurate. I have a 12watt device that would not activate the switch outlet on the low threshold setting (supposedly 10W).
customer_reviews.author: TW

customer_reviews.title: Takes a little getting used to.
customer_reviews.text: Powering everything on takes a few clicks of the power button. The first click of the power button is to just have everything wake up, then you can click it a few more times to get the TV on.
customer_reviews.author: B

customer_reviews.title: Simple, effective product
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a workaround to Roku's lack of a sleep timer. Works fantastic. All I have to do is set my sleep timer on my TV and it will kill all connected devices to kill any streams. Now that Cox has deployed data limits, unfortunately I can't go to sleep and let a channel stream all night. Simple easy to use product, gets the job done.
customer_reviews.author: chalupa2000

customer_reviews.title: Maybe uses less electricity but difficult to figure out or use.
customer_reviews.text: Make sure you plug things in as noted on the strip. There are pictures and words but the paper that comes with this is useless I am a tech person and found this a bit difficult to make work right. No fun having things not power on as you want them too.
customer_reviews.author: A. Brink

customer_reviews.title: Could damage items that are plugged into it.
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy! This has been resetting sensitive audio equipment while in operation and jeopardizes the equipment. Basically the everything on the power strip looses power while control outlet is in use In disturbed , then pops back up hitting everything at once with a charge. Returning for refund.
customer_reviews.author: acideye

customer_reviews.title: Good idea, poor results
customer_reviews.text: After 7 months it cuts off at random. In the middle of watching TV, playing games, etc. Connected to Samsung smart TV, PS3, Wii, surround sound, old vcr.
customer_reviews.author: J Dunning

customer_reviews.title: Great for energy savings
customer_reviews.text: I was tired of the kids forgetting to turn off their various game systems and having them run unused for days. This strip solves that problem. Just turn off the TV and the dvd player and game systems turn off simultaneously. Allows for cable boxes or other devices to stay on if needed. Would be great to use for computer devices too. Love the energy savings!
customer_reviews.author: momofQ&D

customer_reviews.title: Causes more problems than it solves
customer_reviews.text: I tried to use my PC as the controller which worked once or twice, but now the entire strip turns on no matter if I turn my PC on or not. Another larger problem that I suspect to be caused by this product but am not completely sure is often when I turn my computer on my room's breaker switches. I have tried moving my computer to other rooms in my house but the same problem still arises. I will be buying a new power strip soon.
customer_reviews.author: Jack Mirenzi

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't seem to work well with plasma TV
customer_reviews.text: Worked initially, TV turns off then switches went off. That didn't last long however. Now the switches all stay on even when TV is off. Doesn't matter which power setting sensitivity. Not saving me from any ghost power. I'm guessing the switches are designed around detecting LED TVs and not plasma.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Solid but motion detecting feature could work better.
customer_reviews.text: So long as you change the volume now and then, you're fine. The motion detecting feature sometimes sees you and keeps the TV on, but you can't rely on it the way using an IR remote works. All in all, solid and results in power savings.
customer_reviews.author: Tiresias

customer_reviews.title: Works well for turning off streaming device.
customer_reviews.text: Works very well and I would definitely recommend. Like other reviews make sure you adjust the voltage sensitively based on what your primary device is.
customer_reviews.author: Flash & Thunder

customer_reviews.title: Works great for streaming sleep timer!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a solution for shutting down my streaming device while going to sleep so that it did not stream all night. For that purpose it works great. Just set the sleep timer on your TV, and when it shuts down it automatically cuts power to the streamer as well.
customer_reviews.author: Chem Guy

customer_reviews.title: Power strip that switches off power to peripherals plugged in when the master device goes to sleep!
customer_reviews.text: Using it for about a year. Great power strip to use when you want to switch off peripherals when the main device (like computer or TV) goes to sleep mode).
customer_reviews.author: ASA

customer_reviews.title: Love it, worth the purchase
customer_reviews.text: I am a professional computer person. During the day I have 3 monitors, tower and laptop as well as speakers, usb etc... lots of power being sucked. Even when I shutdown for the night, speakers and other stuff stayed powered up unless I crawled under my desk and turned off the plug strip or hit the power buttons on all my toys. Now, I turn off my tower and everything shuts down. This is great!
customer_reviews.author: Psoup

customer_reviews.title: Works great for a computer
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a product that would help me save energy and keep my speakers quiet in the middle of the night. Since many devices use a lot of power to start up, i also did not want them to turn off when my computer goes into standby mode. The 10W seeing acheived this goal, and the strip was very easy to connect and install. If you need more outlets, i recommend getting a vertical wall tap; the horizontal one will block outlets. Good product overall.
customer_reviews.author: Chase

customer_reviews.title: Much better then standard powerstrips
customer_reviews.text: Love these for TV's set up with rokus because I hate that roku's don't turn off, only go to sleep, but they still use around 3 watts and stay warm, which is the #1 thing that shortens life of electronics over time. This has worked on multiple TV's and a computer set up
customer_reviews.author: Brian Lane

customer_reviews.title: Almost good
customer_reviews.text: The selector switch is very sensitive. It doesn't really lock into place and if not in the correct location when powering on the control device it will leave everything else powered off as well. Loud bass has moved the switch out of place and shut everything off. Very frustrating! A carefully applied piece of tape has so far cured this issue.

customer_reviews.title: Works as Advertised
customer_reviews.text: I have it hooked up with my 75inch TV on High Threshold Setting and everything on the Slave outlets turns on when I turn on the TV (Speakers, Game Consoles etc)
customer_reviews.author: Troy

customer_reviews.title: This strip did the job nicely.
customer_reviews.text: The sensitivity control makes this strip actually functional for controlling "vampire loads", where previous models distributed by our local power utility did not. My mom is hard of hearing and needed an augmentative sound system to be turned on whenever the television was on. This strip did the job nicely.
customer_reviews.author: Robby

customer_reviews.title: Energy Saver!
customer_reviews.text: I first found out about TrickleStar outlet when I had an energy home audit. I like that they help save energy. I have my desktop and monitors plugged into it. When I power off or put the PC into sleep mode the monitor turns off automatically which I like because I always forget to turn my monitors off.
customer_reviews.author: Queenj

customer_reviews.title: Love these outlets
customer_reviews.text: At 1st it wasn’t working but the company was very helpful and send us another one and it worked perfectly fine
customer_reviews.author: Lil Man

customer_reviews.title: Within 1 month control stopped working
customer_reviews.text: The product did what it said it would but in under 1 month, the control stopped working. I order 2 of these Feb. 28th and both no longer work. I guess that could not handle the day to day usage. This product is extremely expensive for something that Stops working within a month.
customer_reviews.author: Belvade2

customer_reviews.title: Convienent for shutting things down for you.
customer_reviews.text: Got this at my computer desk. The control port is hooked up to my laptop and whenever I shutdown my laptop, it also shuts down my monitor, external speakers and other accessories. Very handy power strip for those things that you forget to turn off. I bought 3 of these...
customer_reviews.author: TxT

customer_reviews.title: Very nice
customer_reviews.text: Totally aside from the environmental aspects of this, it's really quite nice to have all my peripherals turn on together when I power up my PC.
customer_reviews.author: Conor Walsh

customer_reviews.title: save me some power...
customer_reviews.text: great power management tool. installed one on each entertainment center in the house, simplified life so much... took the old tricklestar unit and put it on my PC to control my monitors (there's 4 of them)
customer_reviews.author: Brett J. Monroe

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: Takes getting use to with the sensor. So far I like it cause stuff powers off in my daughters room saving me energy and the tv shuts off also so it’s not a blank screen all night long.
customer_reviews.author: Bluecowgirl

customer_reviews.title: Essential for my Roku bandwith conservation!
customer_reviews.text: This works great for limiting my Roku bandwith consumption! When I turn the TV off it turns the Roku off! Have not exceeded my ISP monthly allowance using two Roku's! It just works!
customer_reviews.author: SFC

customer_reviews.title: Does the Job.
customer_reviews.text: Would be nice if it has a couple of usb ports. This one works better with a laptop as the master than other vendors like Cyber Power.
customer_reviews.author: F. Chung

customer_reviews.title: Took some fiddling with the threshold to make it work with a laptop, but now its perfect.
customer_reviews.text: I tested this with a powerful Clevo 17" laptop in the master, and 2 monitors, speakers, and a printer in the switched. At first it didn't work on any threshold level, as the monitor light would stay on always. I think it was because my laptop was still charging while off? I think as soon as it got near fully charged it worked. It even works now when the laptop is slept. I had to set the threshold to high for the other stuff to shut off when the laptop is either slept or shut off.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher P Courtney

customer_reviews.title: Good Design
customer_reviews.text: Love the indicator lights. Identified a loose ground that I was not aware of.
customer_reviews.author: D GIBSON

customer_reviews.title: Great for MAME cabinet.
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my MAME cabinet so that I can leave it plugged in and have the marquee lamp, monitor, and speakers power on and off with the computer. Works great.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Bird

customer_reviews.title: If you live in Los Angeles, buy this it's free
customer_reviews.text: If you live in LA and have LADWP, they actually give you a $15 rebate for this product. Great product for the price...which in my case I made $1 net on this with the rebate.
customer_reviews.author: Alexandra

customer_reviews.title: Amazing so far!
customer_reviews.text: Just started using it but so far so good. It does what it says. It cuts power to the controlled outlets if the device on the main (controller)outlet is off. Waiting on my next electric bill to see how much of an impact it has and I'll update this review afterwards.
customer_reviews.author: The Great One

customer_reviews.title: Does what you want it to do!
customer_reviews.text: Works great, especially having TV as master switch, sensitivity selector set to medium to control streaming media stick and soundbar.Unsure if it's the best surge protection you can buy at this price, but good value for a master/slave outlet device.
customer_reviews.author: Chaz

customer_reviews.title: I use this to link LED shop light to my ...
customer_reviews.text: I use this to link LED shop light to my garage opener, and has been working very well for that purpose. Recently, it started tripping on its own and haven't been able to determine why...
customer_reviews.author: Unspecified

customer_reviews.title: Great power strip that works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Does what it's supposed to. I use it with my desktop setup having my desktop switch off the other outlets for monitors and speakers. Switches on both power off and sleep. The port covers are a nice touch. Everything is nice quality plastics and feels sturdy. Only complaint is the LED indicator lights can be rather bright in a dark room.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: I use this for our living room entertainment center. ...
customer_reviews.text: I use this for our living room entertainment center. I use the TV as the master, so when it turns off, so do all of our devices such as DVD player, chrome cast and game systems. Helps save a little extra power!
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Works great.
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly as described. No problems with it so far. It is a bit pricey for what I needed it for but I paid the price to fix my problem.
customer_reviews.author: Terry L. McManus

customer_reviews.title: Does the Job
customer_reviews.text: We are using this in conjunction with our TV's. I don't like the idea of multiple input devices using energy when not in use. This allows us to shut them down when the TV is off.
customer_reviews.author: R T

customer_reviews.title: Computer/entertainment center set-up
customer_reviews.text: I didn’t read all the literature when ordering this if I had I would have realized it would work for my needs. The concept it great just not what I was looking for.
customer_reviews.author: lizzietish

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I love this product. I have a two video game systems and a wireless headphone that only need to be on when the TV is on so this works our perfectly. Over the long haul this save a some money so it was a no brainer to buy.
customer_reviews.author: James H

customer_reviews.title: High quality. Good Price
customer_reviews.text: High quality. Good Price. Control your electronics. Works Great. Will order again
customer_reviews.author: Paul Tatom

customer_reviews.title: Not exactly what I thought I was getting.
customer_reviews.text: We plugged out tv and other devices into this and now our Google Home doesn't work with our tv. It also shuts the tv completely off so no I have to hit the power button 3 times to get the tv to turn on. Power saving is great, but not really worth the aggrevation.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra Marlow

product_meta.title: TrickleStar 7 Outlet Advanced PowerStrip, 1080 Joules, 3ft cord
feature_bullets: LED Status Indication (Ground, Surge Status, Control, Switched Outlets)

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars513 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
